title: >>> Name OF THE Game
body_text:
HTH Contest #2
Participants: Juan Londono, Lauren Stopa, Lauren Winston, Mike Edwards, Mike "Sputz" Krott, Ray Marzarella, Ryan Letsche, Valerie Winston.
The charismatic Juan Londono nailed victim Justin Pierce after two successful and rather quick rounds, defeating all comers in the second pregame of its kind and moving on to the main event spot of DODGEBALL 96.
AVAKIAN vs. LONDONO
The powerhouses Megill and Tronolone, the titans Kerr, Bertsch, and DiBuccio, and of course the captains, Rob Avakian and Juan Londono. A mid-summer showdown, one of energy, excitement, and dare (I) say "skillz that thrillz". This was simply amazing.
One of the closest bouts ever recorded, the
Avakian/Londono
encounter will unquestionably rank among the best for a number of reasons. First and foremost, the captains were seemingly unstoppable, each proving why they are to be taken seriously. The suicidal, yet agile Rob Avakian put on a dodging clinic while his resilient counterpart possessed the super-glue hands, suckering in enemies into his tricks, catching anything and everything. And that's just the start of it.
If Rob and Juan weren't at the frontlines, you can bet powerful new sensation Louie Kossman and the legendary catching machine Mike "Sputz" Krott sure as hell were. It was these two warriors that closed out arguably the most thrilling last seconds of any event, as the inexperienced Kossmann eliminated the award-winning icon to earn Team AVAKIAN the match-winning kill.
Between Mike Edwards' relentless attempts at catching, the double-team tactics of Lauren Stopa and Valerie Winston, and of course the blocking specialties of
PondScum
member Ray Marzarella, those that came, saw, and experienced DODGEBALL 96 were a part of something magical. You had to see it to believe it.
Rob Avakian defeated
Hit the Human
contest winner Juan Londono, 4 to 3, at the 96th dodgeball extravaganza.
DODGEBALL 100 Captains Drawing Results
No doubt, the biggest of them all. Look at the names already -
Kevin Fitzpatrick
,
Justin Pierce
,
Kevin Adams
, and that's only half! The next competitor in the main event of the greatest spectacle in the historical run of dodgeball is none other than the man who started it all,
John Tronolone
. Certainly a hard-earned personal victory for the powerful and agile legend.
Moments & Stars
: Five-star performances from captains Juan Londono and Rob Avakian; Diana DiBuccio's rather hysterical string of bad breaks and unlucky eliminations; John Tronolone's three rimshots on the night; the incredible finale of Game 7.
RECORDS
> Attendance: 23
> Notable Return: Rob Pellecchia (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 85)
> New Players: (1) Tom Deluca
- DODGEBALL 96 played host to just the second
Hit the Human
pregame contest, a simple variation of the popular
Rimshot Contest
. The volunteer "victim" was Justin Pierce, who also served as the first "victim" in the dreaded pregame at DODGEBALL LVIII.
- Rob Avakian picked up the victory against
HTH
winner Juan Londono in perhaps the closest battle in history, 4 games to 3. This was Rob's second time in the captain's chair with a standing record of 1-1-0. Juan has already been in four captains wars since debuting at DODGEBALL 73. This loss puts him at 2-2-0.
- And yet again, the colorful
Letsche Rims
served as team regenerators.
________________________________________
_________
DODGEBALL 97
The
Knights
look to prove their dominance once again. The highly anticipated
WALL vs. ALL 2
hits Wall High School July 21.
DODGEBALL 98
The
Wild Card
Match coming July 28! Four warriors with absolutely nothing in common pair up in a unique two versus two showdown:
Dan Turner
,
Lauren Winston
,
Wesley Hebrew
,
Juan Londono
. What the hell?
DODGEBALL 99
Arguably ... arguably the greatest female against arguably the greatest male. Two powerhouses, two legends,
Alison Bertsch
meets
Tom Adams
on the one year anniversary of DODGEBALL 50, August 4.
DODGEBALL 100
It all goes down August 18. My God.
body_html:
HTH Contest #2
Participants: Juan Londono, Lauren Stopa, Lauren Winston, Mike Edwards, Mike "Sputz" Krott, Ray Marzarella, Ryan Letsche, Valerie Winston.

The charismatic Juan Londono nailed victim Justin Pierce after two successful and rather quick rounds, defeating all comers in the second pregame of its kind and moving on to the main event spot of DODGEBALL 96.

AVAKIAN vs. LONDONO
The powerhouses Megill and Tronolone, the titans Kerr, Bertsch, and DiBuccio, and of course the captains, Rob Avakian and Juan Londono. A mid-summer showdown, one of energy, excitement, and dare (I) say "skillz that thrillz". This was simply amazing.

One of the closest bouts ever recorded, the Avakian/Londono encounter will unquestionably rank among the best for a number of reasons. First and foremost, the captains were seemingly unstoppable, each proving why they are to be taken seriously. The suicidal, yet agile Rob Avakian put on a dodging clinic while his resilient counterpart possessed the super-glue hands, suckering in enemies into his tricks, catching anything and everything. And that's just the start of it.

If Rob and Juan weren't at the frontlines, you can bet powerful new sensation Louie Kossman and the legendary catching machine Mike "Sputz" Krott sure as hell were. It was these two warriors that closed out arguably the most thrilling last seconds of any event, as the inexperienced Kossmann eliminated the award-winning icon to earn Team AVAKIAN the match-winning kill.

Between Mike Edwards' relentless attempts at catching, the double-team tactics of Lauren Stopa and Valerie Winston, and of course the blocking specialties of PondScum member Ray Marzarella, those that came, saw, and experienced DODGEBALL 96 were a part of something magical. You had to see it to believe it.

Rob Avakian defeated Hit the Human contest winner Juan Londono, 4 to 3, at the 96th dodgeball extravaganza.

DODGEBALL 100 Captains Drawing Results
No doubt, the biggest of them all. Look at the names already - Kevin Fitzpatrick, Justin Pierce, Kevin Adams, and that's only half! The next competitor in the main event of the greatest spectacle in the historical run of dodgeball is none other than the man who started it all, John Tronolone. Certainly a hard-earned personal victory for the powerful and agile legend.

Moments & Stars: Five-star performances from captains Juan Londono and Rob Avakian; Diana DiBuccio's rather hysterical string of bad breaks and unlucky eliminations; John Tronolone's three rimshots on the night; the incredible finale of Game 7.

RECORDS
> Attendance: 23
> Notable Return: Rob Pellecchia (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 85)
> New Players: (1) Tom Deluca

- DODGEBALL 96 played host to just the second Hit the Human pregame contest, a simple variation of the popular Rimshot Contest. The volunteer "victim" was Justin Pierce, who also served as the first "victim" in the dreaded pregame at DODGEBALL LVIII.
- Rob Avakian picked up the victory against HTH winner Juan Londono in perhaps the closest battle in history, 4 games to 3. This was Rob's second time in the captain's chair with a standing record of 1-1-0. Juan has already been in four captains wars since debuting at DODGEBALL 73. This loss puts him at 2-2-0.
- And yet again, the colorful Letsche Rims served as team regenerators.
_________________________________________________

DODGEBALL 97
The Knights look to prove their dominance once again. The highly anticipated WALL vs. ALL 2 hits Wall High School July 21.

DODGEBALL 98
The Wild Card Match coming July 28! Four warriors with absolutely nothing in common pair up in a unique two versus two showdown: Dan Turner, Lauren Winston, Wesley Hebrew, Juan Londono. What the hell?

DODGEBALL 99
Arguably ... arguably the greatest female against arguably the greatest male. Two powerhouses, two legends, Alison Bertsch meets Tom Adams on the one year anniversary of DODGEBALL 50, August 4.

DODGEBALL 100
It all goes down August 18. My God.
